title: The social and political life of food in socialist Poland

references.title: Creating a culture of disillusionment: consumption in Moscow, a chronicle of changing times,
references.raw: London: Hutchinson. Volume21, Number 1 Humphrey, C., 1995, Creating a culture of disillusionment: consumption in Moscow, a chronicle of changing times, in Miller, D. (ed.), Worlds Apart: Modernity Through the Prism of the Local. London: Routledge, 43-68.

references.title: Heart of Europe: A Short History of Poland. Oxford:
references.raw: Davies, N. 1984. Heart of Europe: A Short History of Poland. Oxford: Oxford University Press.

references.title: How We Survived Communism and Even Laughed.
references.raw: Drakulic, S., 1992, How We Survived Communism and Even Laughed.

references.title: Meals, Food narratives and sentiments of belonging in past and present,
references.raw: Scholliers, P., 2001, Meals, Food narratives and sentiments of belonging in past and present, in Scholliers, P. (ed.), Food, Drink and Identity: Cooking, Eating and Drinking in Europe since the Middle Ages. Oxford: Berg, 3-22.

references.title: Russia’s Economy of Favours: Blat, Networking and Informal Exchanges.
references.raw: Ledeneva, A.V., 1998, Russia’s Economy of Favours: Blat, Networking and Informal Exchanges. Cambridge, UK: Cambridge University Press.

references.title: Sites of everyday life in the Eastern Bloc,
references.raw: Crowley, D. and Reid, S., 2002, Sites of everyday life in the Eastern Bloc, in Reid, S.E. and Crowley, D. (eds.), Socialist Spaces: Sites of Everyday Life in the Eastern Bloc. Oxford: Berg, 1-22.

references.title: The Private Poland: An Anthropological Look at Everyday Life. New York: Facts on File Publications.
references.raw: Wedel, J., 1986, The Private Poland: An Anthropological Look at Everyday Life. New York: Facts on File Publications.

references.title: Warsaw’s Shops: Stalinism and the Thaw,
references.raw: Crowley, D., 2000, Warsaw’s Shops: Stalinism and the Thaw, in Reid, S.E. and Crowley, D. (eds.), Style and Socialism: Modernity and Material Culture in PostWar Eastern Europe. Oxford: Berg, 25-48.

references.title: Women Under Communism.
references.raw: Jancar, B.W., 1978, Women Under Communism. Baltimore: John Hopkins University Press.
